explosives.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

flammable_gases.rationale: Based on the description in ICSC (2004): the lower explosion limit is 1.1vol%. Those containing stabilizers are classified into Division 2.1 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#1010)

oxidizing_gases.rationale: No data available Those containing stabilizers are classified into Division 2.1 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#1010)

gases_under_pressure.rationale: The boiling point is -4degC (ICSC 2004), and the critical temperature is 161.8degC (HSDB (2005)) - i.e., liquefied gas. Those containing stabilizers are classified into Division 2.1 (UN#1010)(UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

organic_peroxides.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to gaseous substances are not available.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Classified as "not classified," Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) of 5,480mg/kg (EU-RAR No.20 (2002)). 1,3-butadiene is a gas under ambient conditions, with its water solubility standing at 735mg/L (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.9 (2005)). However, the method of oral administration is unknown and the data are not considered "reliable," hence classified as "classification not possible."

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LC50 (4-hour inhalation of gas) of 129,000ppm (EU-RAR No.20 (2002)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "gas" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its vapour is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "gas" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its dust/mist is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Insufficient data available. Human cases are reported where exposure to 1,3-butadiene caused skin frostbite ((CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.9 (2005)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: The substances is considered "irritating" to rabbit and human eyes, based on the description in EU-RAR No.20 (2002), which also indicates that standard eye irritation tests cannot be performed because butadiene is a gas under ambient conditions.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: No data available

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on positive data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests (mouse dominant lethal tests), described in EU-RAR No.20 (2002).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category K (Known to be human carcinogens) by NTP (2005).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Insufficient data available (no data available on the reproductive function of parent animals)

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "irritation to the eyes, nasal tract, larynx and lungs, associated with cough" (CERI Hazard Data 96-21 (1997)), and the evidence from animal studies including "mild narcotic influence" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.9 (2004)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (ovaries) Category 2 (blood system, heart, liver, bone marrow, testes)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "macrocytic megaloblastic anemia, ovarian atrophy, mineralization of the heart muscle, centrilobular hepatocyte necrosis, bone marrow atrophy, testis atrophy" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.9 (2004)). The effects on "ovaries" and "blood system, heart, liver, bone marrow and testes" are observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1 and Category 2, respectively.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data
